pages.text: For one, you spend it first and then wait a short while to get it back. The other, you anticipate it growing by fighting and spend it on powerful effects. Combined, they counteract the $(o)"mana system paradox".$()
pages.title: Combat Mode[1]: Resources

pages.text: $(#FF3333)Might$() and $(#33FFFF)Spirit$() are two resources used mostly for casting skills.$(br2)Spirit starts full and is consumed as a sort of mana for normal skills, before relatively quickly restoring itself back to full. $(br2)Meanwhile, Might is gradually built up during a fight and used to cast more impactful skills later as a reward.

$(#33FFFF)Spirit$() regenerates at a point every 2 seconds. Consuming spirit or taking damage will pause its regeneration for 2 seconds. $(br2)$(o)Parrying a hit conserves spirit regeneration$() but becoming $(l:footwork:selfdefense/fracture0)fractured$() from a posture break will prevent spirit regeneration while you are recovering.

$(#FF3333)Might$() is built with every attack, the rate determined by the base attack rate of your weapon. Slower weapons and attacks generate it faster. Might remains stable for up to 10 seconds, before gradually dropping back down until empty. $(br2)If you have might being held and take damage, your might will immediately start to decay. Be sure to fight back to maintain it, even in a tough fight!
